Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: mimmc
Reviews.Content: Excellent staff, clean throughout, quiet (our room at back) good breakfast,comfortable bed and good sized room and en-suite for the price. Convenient for Place de Bastille, Marais, Place des Vosges.and Metro stops. Would definitely use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Zeer tevreden”
Reviews.Author: Elien C
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and helpful staff. Free internet and located in a verry good area ( oberkampf ), nearby nice restaurants and shops.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and staff!!”
Reviews.Author: seattle29
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 days with my girlfriend, and the staff immediately greeted us and made us feel at home. The location was great and the breakfast buffet was very nice, if not a bit expensive. But Paris is an expensive city. There are 3 Metro stops nearby so access is easy, and it's about a 20 minute walk to Notre Dame.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Ellen-Marie
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed 3 nights in mid-December and totally concur with other reviewers - this hotel is really great. Staff outstandingly pleasant and helpful, including the cleaning ladies (though we did speak French) - reception staff speak English too. Our room on the second floor (there is a lift) was smallish, but very well organised with cupboard space, and a safe, so we didn't feel cramped - bathroom was a good size. Everything was spotlessly clean. We overlooked rue Amelot across to rue Saint Gilles - great view and not noisy. Near 2 metro stations on different lines which was useful. Location just on eastern edge of the Marais means easy to walk to lots of places. We will certainly be back!

Reviews.Title: “Fab!”
Reviews.Author: Sparkles38
Reviews.Content: Stayed on a single room for 2 nights over New Years. 3 other friends were also in the hotel. I thought it was a fab hotel in a brilliant location. Very clean and the reception staff spoke excellent English. Close to 2 metro stations and the Marais. Totally recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: Banjo_Pug
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed in an attractive twin room in early December. We were warmly welcomed upon arrival and all of the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The hotel is very close to two Metro stops and it is an easy walk to Bastille. The location is great and our room was very comfortable with good beds, pillows, etc. We would certainly stay here again if we re-visit Paris.

Reviews.Title: “lovely little hotel”
Reviews.Author: 1sabell3
Reviews.Content: Bastille de Launay is located in the Marais, one of my favorite areas in Paris. About a 2 minute walk from Place de Voges it is well located. The hotel is cosy, so the rooms like most in Paris aren't huge but they are well appointed and clean. The staff are super friendly. The price is fantastic for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel @ la bastille. Metro Chemin Vert 100m away.”
Reviews.Author: Lefere
Reviews.Content: This is my usual hotel in Paris. clean and nice rooms, very friendly staff and excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely decor, lovely staff, good location”
Reviews.Author: vyenoz
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff are all warm and friendly, and offers some good advice too. It's near to the Metro so getting around is quite easy. The room is clean and the decor is tasteful. The only thing we regret not doing in our 4 night stay was not spending the time to walk around Bastille shops. If I do come back I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “It worked for us”
Reviews.Author: BAW44
Reviews.Content: After traveling in East Africa for 4 weeks, we stayed here to rest before a ling trip back to Alaska. Friendly, helpful staff..rooms not too small, clean. A good choice fir us.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: urbantraveler80
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was a bit small, but very clean. There is a computer for guest use in the lobby. There is also free Wi-fi. It rained one evening and the staff let us borrow umbrellas. We did not eat breakfast at this hotel. The hotel is two blocks away from the metro station and very close to Marais. There are a number of bakeries on a major street one block away. I would definitely stay here again if I come back to Paris. There is a great restaurant "La Cuizine" down the street. Check it out for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Bit far, small rooms, but very friendly!”
Reviews.Author: Jenny S
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a pleasant surprise. It's located in the Bastille area; one metro ride away from the heart of Paris. It was down a side street which seemed a bit precarious at first but was fine throughout our stay. We were comfortable walking at night, especially along the main road just one block up from the hotel. The hotel staff were very friendly, always greeting us warmly and providing good recommendations. They were some of the most courteous staff we've encountered on our 4-week tour of Europe. The room was small, but had a beautiful view of the nearby neighbourhood. The bathroom was small and the hairdryer was really weak. Overall, great value for Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel with small rooms”
Reviews.Author: julaHolland
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very clean and well kept. The breakfastbuffet is good. The staff very friendly and helpful. On an excellent location near the metrostation Chemin Vert and Bastille. Very near le Marais and excellent restaurants and brasseries. But everything is small in this hotel, the lobby, the lift, the room, the bathroom, the breakfastroom. No hotel for people of more than average size. The queensizebed has a real hard matrass.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Maxine B
Reviews.Content: I am so impressed with this hotel - my cousin and I spent 2 nights at this hotel. It was in a great location, 5 minutes walk from Bastille and the rooms, while small, were very clean and modern. It is excellent value for money. The breakfast was also fabulous, with the option to have it up in your room (no extra charge) or downstairs in a converted wine cellar which was wonderful. The staff at the front desk were also very friendly. One night we had booked a taxi to Moulin Rouge which never came and the guy at the front desk ordered us another one, without any dramas which was great. The girl on the front desk during the day was always very busy but she was very competant and always friendly and didn't mind that we couldn't speak a word of French - she spoke English very well. On the last day in Paris I got food poisoning from a restaurant and the owner of the hotel sent up a pot of tea to our room free of charge and was very kind. Very happy with experience, would definitely stay at this place again - an absolute gem.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: RogerDonnelly
Reviews.Content: We spent 9 nights at the hotel in late September. Our USA flight was delayed, we reached them - was not a problem. Wonderful little room and great front desk staff. Would not hesitate to suggest this to others. 5 minute walk to Bastille metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Christine M
Reviews.Content: My adult grandson and I stayed here for 7 nights. I booked 2 single rooms -- space was more than adequate and very clean. Service was fantastic. The staff always went out of their way to accommodate us -- opened breakfast early two mornings because of our departure schedules. The location was great -- just a couple of blocks to the nearest Metro station. We also enjoyed the surrounding neighborhood -- many great restaurants within easy walking distance. I plan to return to Paris and will definitely book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel in Great AREA”
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel because of Trip Advisor reviews. I was very pleased with the accomodations and the staff. Over the course of three days I encounterted four front desk staff members. All were friendly and enthusiastic to assist. The room was clean and appeared freshly painted. The bathroom was fairly large for Paris standards. The hotel is a few minutes walk from the Bastille metro stop. This is a very lively stop with many restaurants and cafes and a large open market on Sunday morning. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very cute hotel!”
Reviews.Author: amijich
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for two nights on a quick trip to Paris and we have nothing but lovely things to say about our experience here. The price firstly, was unbeatable and especially with the dollar being so week it was such a huge selling point. The rooms were clearly just renovated, very clean sleek and modern. The rooms are definitely small but if you don't plan in staying in them much it's really not a big deal. The staff was very helpful and lovely and location location location! Absolutely perfect. Just a couple blocks away from the Marais district and the Bastille and also very close to options for public transportation. All in all great hotel and would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: susan w
Reviews.Content: Tried to book this hotel again on our return but fully booked. Perhaps it should be kept a secret, it is a gem.

Reviews.Title: “Possibly the best welcome I've ever had in a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: VimesFan
Reviews.Content: Superb service, bright and stylish decor, spotlessly clean rooms, and lots of thoughtful extras made this hotel a great choice for a 4 day break in Paris. We took the Metro there on arrival by Eurostar and were able to leave our suitcases there despite it being before check-in time. As there are few escalators on the lines out to the Maris district we took a taxi back to Gare du Nord four days later and at 15 euros it was probably a better choice. We chose not to have breakfast in the hotel [11 euros each], instead visiting local cafes which varied from 4.50 - 6 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Great Parisian gem, perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Laura_and_Neil
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bastille de Launay for 2 nights in July & loved it. We requested a room on a high floor with a nice view, and we got the highest possible room overlooking the courtyard with double opening full length windows. If you were on the other side of the hotel I believe there would be no view, and if we were any lower it would've been noisy as the road behind Rue de Amelot is very busy. The room is small but so are all rooms in Paris, it was very modern and cleaned every day, we have zero complaints. We didn't have a breakfast in the hotel so can't comment on that I'm afraid, there are hundreds of authentic boulangeries & pattisseries you'd be mad to eat in the hotel! If you're in a rush or on business, we could reccommend a boulangerie a few metres along the road from the hotel (up the steps opposite and along that road towards the Bastille Column). Location is perfect! The closest Metro line is Chemin Vert, but we found not as many of the lines ran through this station, so we used Bastille station mostly which is only another few minutes walk up the same road, and Bastille connects to all of the busier Metro Lines. I have also done a couple of reviews on the restaurants we ate in, may be useful for you :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CocoBeans65
Reviews.Content: Would certainly recommend this hotel, It is spotlessly clean, staff are very helpful and pleasant. The room we had was small but had everything we needed. The breakfast area was in the basement but again absolutely spotless and the continental breakfast was plentiful and fresh. It is also very convenient to pick up tours and within walking distance of the Seine and some of the main tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: viaggiando_ancora
Reviews.Content: Perfect location near the Bastille and the Marais, 5 min walk to Place des Vosges. The staff is very friendly, although several of us had to wait for our rooms to be ready despite arriving after 14h. My room and bathroom were REALLY tiny, bordering on non-functional, and it took awhile to figure out how to get the room to the proper temperature. But the size of the room didn't really matter since I was hardly there, and the quality of sleep was excellent. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: WideBoyDixon
Reviews.Content: Having read lots of good things about this hotel, we decided to book in for our romantic weekend in Paris. The hotel was spotless and the staff were all fantastically friendly and informative. I'd definitely recommend this place to other travellers and I would be happy to stay there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great value near the Bastille”
Reviews.Author: BethyMac
Reviews.Content: For the money, this was an excellent place to stay near the Bastille. Two metro lines are within 3 blocks, plus countless restaurants and shops. I stayed in a single room, which was small but well appointed - and quiet! The decor was a little shabby, but the room was clean and perfect for me. The desk staff was AMAZING! And there's a computer for internet access in the lobby (I never had to wait). I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “We couldn't be more satisfied!”
Reviews.Author: yael_ko
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the hotel for 7 nights and enjoyed every second. The staff were super helpful and pleasant, the room was very cute and clean, everything was new. The location was great and very central but in a quiet street (close to 3 metro stations, bars, restaurants, cafes, etc.). The hotel offers free WiFi- there's a computer in the lobby, and the WiFi works in the rooms as well. We didn't take the breakfast so we don't know how good it is.

Reviews.Title: “Gracious Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: thatslifenfl
Reviews.Content: This beautiful botique hotel is a delightful surprise on the edge of the 11th Arrondisement, near the 4th Arrondisement.The staff was very gracious, and anxious to be of assistance. The hotel sets a few steps away from a main boulevard, and the nearest metro, Chermin Vert is less than a 5 minute stroll away. Place de Vosges is a few blocks away. Though the hotel rooms are a little worn, the staff works diligently to keep it impeccably clean.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel, little privacy or soundproofing in ground floor room”
Reviews.Author: ryancropp
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel located really conveniently for the Marais and Bastille district. Our room was clean and well appointed and the bathroom was clean. The staff are friendly and keen to help. The breakfast is great. However, we were located in the room on the ground floor right next to reception and we were pretty disappointed with the poor soundproofing which made for interrupted sleep with people coming in and out of reception. We complained to reception and they said that there were no other rooms available. Stay here, but try and avoid getting that room if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Aleina81
Reviews.Content: trendy hotel in the heart of Paris. Rooms are small (but you'd expect that in Paris) but they are extremely clean, the furniture is new and the room is bright and cosy. Having stayed in Paris before, we were extremely pleased with this hotel as it really does not look like a 2 star hotel. The staff were nice and helpful and the location is perfect as it's close to lovelt Marais. I will definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, Charming!”
Reviews.Author: oatstrawtea
Reviews.Content: Rarely am I compelled to write reviews on this, but I just returned from a six night stay here and found every aspect of this place infinitely charming. The rooms are small, but pleasant, they are incredibly clean and the space is well utilized. The service was outstanding, we were always happily greeted upon arrival and departure. I also noticed the cleaning ladies payed excellent attention to detail, we always returned to a well cleaned, vacuumed and dusted room. The breakfast was wonderful and being able to have it delivered to our room was a fantastic bonus. The location is ideally situated very close to the Bastille stop as well as great shops, restaurants and bars. There is also a wonderful market nearby on Sundays. I will say that initially I was a bit wary of staying at a two star hotel, but this definitely exceeds its star rating with service and attention on par if not better than a five star hotel. I will definitely be back and am thrilled to have found a go to in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Great home base for my solo trip to Paris”
Reviews.Author: Kewpie11
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights while on a solo Parisian vacation. As a woman traveling alone, I was very concerned about security, and I always felt safe here. The hotel is on a side street with not much traffic (which is nice because the neighborhood is not too noisy), but right across the street is a pass-through to a main boulevard with shops, restaurants, and banks, and I never felt uncomfortable walking around by myself (though I was usually back at the hotel by 10PM). I had a single room which had not yet been redecorated like the pictures shown on the website. It was, however, very clean. It was pretty compact, but not uncomfortably small, and contained a desk, bed, and armoire (no closet) plus an ensuite bathroom. The bathroom unfortunately did not contain a bathtub (as was listed on the hotel's reservation website), but did have a toilet and small shower. There was a small refrigerator (no freezer compartment) tucked into the desk, but I did not see a safe in my room as has been mentioned in other reviews. There was no alarm clock supplied, so bring your own if you like being able to glance at the clock during the night. It was of course, possible to schedule a wake-up call, so the alarm clock was not completely necessary. There was a newer flat panel TV that got several channels in French, 2 channels in English (CNN and a sports channel), and, I think, a couple of channels in other languages. The size of the room did not matter much as I spent most of the day out in the city. The hotel is very close to the Marais, which was good as I was there on a Sunday and unlike much of the rest of the city, shops in the Marais were open that day. The hotel is also extremely close to the Chemin Vert station, and just a bit farther from the Breguet Sabin and Bastille stations. From these three stations, it is easy to go to almost anyplace you'd want to go in Paris. The hotel is within walking distance of Notre Dame, Centre Pompidou, Place des Vosges, and I even walked to the Louvre (a long walk, but I enjoy going on foot rather than by metro as I get to explore the various neighborhoods). There were lots of nice restaurants nearby, as well as some cheaper chain places. There are a couple of Franprix minimarts close by as well if you want to stock up on groceries. I did not try the breakfast at the hotel. It was extremely easy to access the hotel from Charles de Gaulle - I took the RER to Gare Nord and then Metro line 5 (towards Place d'Italie) and got off at Breguet Sabin. From there the hotel is just a few blocks walk. Getting connected to the free wifi using my Ipod Touch could be a bit flaky (the login screen would disappear while I was trying to enter my userid, etc.) but once I got on, the connection was pretty good. The staff were unfailingly polite and spoke excellent English, though they were extremely patient while humoring me with my horrendous French. I would definitely stay here again if I were to return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: AHolidayGuy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the centre of Paris, in a quiet area. It is located 2 minutes walk from Chemin Vert station, from where the trains go directly to the touristy area of Opera. The hotel itself is on a quiet side street, and there are numerous restaurants nearby that are open till late. I found the hotel to be very basic - in fact, I stayed in Paris for a total of 3 months, and later on I found other better hotels for a cheaper price that were more central. My room was quite small, and the furnishing was very old. There was no bath in the washroom, just a shower. The staff were friendly, they always greeted me with a smile. The wireless internet was below average, quite often it would disconnect after about 10 minutes, sometimes you would be unable to connect, and sometimes it would be very slow. To sum up, this is not a bad hotel, it is after all a 2 star, and for that it is fine - I just found that there are other better hotels which are more central that happened to be cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: vandenhaak
Reviews.Content: The only negative thing about the hotel was that the room we had was very small, but that is common for Paris i gues. But the room had it all: inroom safe, minibar, flatscreen, AC, nice format twin beds, even smaller bathroom with bath, amneties. The room and bathroom were also very,very clean. Compliments! The front desk staff were also very helpful and friendly and spoke good english. The location was also perfect for us, on the edge of the Marais district (5 min walk) with very interesting shops. It took about 30 minutes to walk to the Notre Dame so we did many things by foot or took the metro. Also very good restaurants nearby such as the Bar a huitres de Bastille (5 min walk) and the famous brasserie Bofinger (10 min walk) Make a reservation for both places because they were loaded with people at the weekends. So all in all we had a very nice stay in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “trendy, clean and great location”
Reviews.Author: AJIR_10
Reviews.Content: I was so pleasantly surprised! An immaculately clean, modern hotel. Very friendly and professional people at reception that are always polite and great at giving directions and tips on where to visit. Room had all comforts for a great and comfi stay - aircon, clean daily with new towels, tv, small desk. Bed very comfortable for great sleep. Close to Metro and other interesting shops. A lively area to be in. Well worth the stay!

Reviews.Title: “Quaint Parisian Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SC070
Reviews.Content: Hotel Bastille de Launay was a quaint nice Parisian hotel. The location is great - close to La Republique, Opera, Bastille. Rooms were nice an roomy. Bathroom had a nice tub, was clean. Service was helpful. The only complaint I have about this hotel, which the hotel people probably can't really do about, was that when I opened the curtains at 5:30am in the morning, there was a couple having some intimate fun times on the steps across the street from the hotel. That wasn't something I wanted to see or wake up to. Oh well. Of the 3 Paris hotels I stayed in, I would stay at Hotel Nicolo or any lodging nearby in that location.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable hotel with friendly staff and clean rooms at good location”
Reviews.Author: quarkey
Reviews.Content: My wife and me stayed at the hotel last weekend. It was quite easy to get to from the Paris Nord train station. Very friendly and helpful staff helped us get our rooms (in English!). Rooms were a bit small but everything was very clean and the bed and shower were very comfortable. I would really recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and friendly reasonably priced hotel”
Reviews.Author: SthLondonTravellers
Reviews.Content: This hotel has an excellent location near to Place Bastille metro (direct from Gare du Nord) and a short stroll from the excellent Marais district. Paris is much more compact than maps suggest and you can walk to most sights - or take the (cheap) metro. There are a number of bistro's, bakeries and fast food options nearby. The hotel is good and was perfect for a three night stay, compact yet very clean rooms with good aircon. The staff were very friendly at all times. I feel I should comment on the review below as I also made a error with my booking - mistakenly booked a single room which I only checked the night before arrival and two of us were travelling! This was fixed very quickly with a phone call to the hotel and the payment of a small supplement at check out. No hassle at all. Didn't have the breakfast so cannot comment on that. No coffee making facility which would have made the room perfect for three nights - as coffee goes for 5 euro + a cup in Paris!! Try the hotels own website for booking as I found a good August deal there - it was non-refundable though.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convenient and well located”
Reviews.Author: Chovinsky
Reviews.Content: Personnel is very amiable and room was made ready although I was hours early. Room was very small - but this is Paris and you don't really spend much time in a hotel room unless you're sitting on gold and rather blasÃ©. Room was very clean and quite comfortable, equipped with all that you really need. Free Wifi was a great plus. Breakfast is on he expensive side - I would recommend going to nearby restaurants instead. I think the best thing about this small 36 room hotel is that it is very close to a Paris district called "Le Marais" which is one of the trendiest portions of this ever charming city, yet not only offering sites such as Place Des Voges, but also real neighbourrghood life unlike some of the more tourist like areas... I have been to Paris many times and would choose this district again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible staff attitude”
Reviews.Author: yhmspy
Reviews.Content: There was a mistake in my booking - I booked a single room but my husband would be joining me on the second day of my stay. I was ready to pay for an extra bed, but the hotel staff didn't say anything when my husband checked-in a day later. I thought that's no big deal, since they didn't mention, my husband and I could just share the bed and save some money. A night passed by, we went out the next morning, greeted the staff as a couple - still nobody say anything. We had a last night on the 2nd day, we went back to the hotel passed midnight. You wouldn't believe what the staff at the reception told me. He said that it was my fault that I booked a single room for 2 people and according to the hotel policy, they can't let two people stay in a single room. (mind you, the attitude was POOR, he kept blaming on me and other staff for not telling me earlier! I asked him to prepare for an extra bed and I'd pay for it, he said NO. I said I'd pay for the difference of a double room, he said NO. He said, "The only solution is that my husband has to leave the hotel IMMEDIATELY." (we're talking about 1am at night) I asked him, "Is this how the French interpret 'hospitality'?" Then he gave me the first "YES" of the night. Incredible isn't it? To keep the story short. We finally got the police invovled. (at around 2am, I needed to explain the situation to the police with my terrible French.) And the whole thing was so-call settled. To be fair, it is a nice and clean hotel and the staff I met other times were wonderful. Just be careful when hiccups happen.

Reviews.Title: “Best Small Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: speakeasy365
Reviews.Content: This is a fabulous hotel, instantly welcoming, very friendly and hospitable. It is spotlessly clean, and well organised. The rooms are small but neat and well designed, with enough space for comfort. Foreign visitors may be used to huge hotel rooms but this is Paris where most buildings are compact. The bathrooms have great showers and lovely fresh towels. Room cleaners don't bang on the door too early and are respectful if you are sleeping in. The decor and design is modern and fresh, not a brass handle or red carpet to be seen anywhere thankfully. Free wifi all over the hotel and 24hr door staff, close to metro and some lovely cafes and restaraunts.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Modern Contemporary Cozy hotel. Good for value.”
Reviews.Author: JustineLW
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a night. The room decoration is something I enjoy, simple and modern style. (I mean, not that kind of Red carpet of typical Paris hotel...) It's quite clean and looks new. The staff in reception desk is very helpful and friendly. Free WIFI service and with English TV channel (even just one CNN, which is great already). The location is very convinient for visiting Marais district and might just take 15 mins to the banck of Seine where you can enjoy Parisian river walk. The only thing I concern is the transportation to airport. There are quite a few airport shuttle services(25-30 Euro) provided in hotels this area, however for my Sunday departure, they are all fully booked in which I decide to take taxi (50-55 something) due to difficult to travel to CDG with a big suitcase by Metro. It is suggested to book airport shuttle service 1 or 2 days earlier than departure to make sure a seat available.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: CauRons
Reviews.Content: I booked Bastille de Launay just a month earlier my trip, then I got a special price at his homepage. The hotel is very clean, the room is very comfortable whit a/c and a queen size bed. We didn't have any breakfast, found kind of expensive, 11 dollars. The location is great, we can get Place de la Bastille, Place des Vosges and Ile de Notre Dame on foot. Neaby there's many cafes and restaurants and two lines of metro with the stations Breguet-Sabin and Chemin Vert.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, well located, good size rooms, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: LLondoner
Reviews.Content: We stayed here just for one night but would go back for longer. It was great for us and our two year old. We had a good size double (for Paris and the price) with space for a travel cot which the hotel was happy to provide. The staff were really friendly and the location is excellent, a short walk from the lively Marais and close to Metro stations (Chemin Vert much neare than Bastille, not always clear from web maps). Lovely Sunday market and canal walks nearby too.

HotelInfo.Name: Bastille de Launay Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 42, rue Amelot | 11th Arr., 75011 Paris, France
